verses.verse: Even <S%H1571><s%> to day <S%H3117><s%> is my complaint <S%H7879><s%> bitter: <S%H4805><s%> my stroke <S%H3027><s%> is heavier <S%H3513><s%> than <S%H5921><s%> my groaning. <S%H585><s%>
Oh that I knew <S%H3045><s%> where I might find <S%H4672><s%> him! that I might come <S%H935><s%> even to his seat! <S%H8499><s%>
I would order <S%H6186><s%> my cause <S%H4941><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> him, and fill <S%H4390><s%> my mouth <S%H6310><s%> with arguments. <S%H8433><s%>
I would know <S%H3045><s%> the words <S%H4405><s%> which he would answer <S%H6030><s%> me, and understand <S%H995><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> he would say <S%H559><s%> to me.
Will he plead <S%H7378><s%> against <S%H5978><s%> me with his great <S%H7227><s%> power? <S%H3581><s%> No; <S%H3808><s%> but he would put <S%H7760><s%> strength in me.
There <S%H8033><s%> the righteous <S%H3477><s%> might dispute <S%H3198><s%> with him; so should I be delivered <S%H6403><s%> for ever <S%H5331><s%> from my judge. <S%H8199><s%>
Behold, <S%H2005><s%> I go <S%H1980><s%> forward, <S%H6924><s%> but he is not there; and backward, <S%H268><s%> but I cannot <S%H3808><s%> perceive <S%H995><s%> him:

On the left <S%H8040><s%> hand, <S%H8040><s%> where he does work, <S%H6213><s%> but I cannot <S%H3808><s%> behold <S%H2372><s%> him: he hides <S%H5848><s%> himself <S%H5315><s%> on the right <S%H3225><s%> hand, <S%H3225><s%> that I cannot <S%H3808><s%> see <S%H7200><s%> him:
But he knows <S%H3045><s%> the way <S%H1870><s%> that I take: <S%H5978><s%> when he has tried <S%H974><s%> me, I shall come <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> as gold. <S%H2091><s%>
My foot <S%H7272><s%> has held <S%H270><s%> his steps, <S%H838><s%> his way <S%H1870><s%> have I kept, <S%H8104><s%> and not declined. <S%H5186><s%>

Neither <S%H3808><s%> have I gone <S%H4185><s%> back <S%H4185><s%> from the commandment <S%H4687><s%> of his lips; <S%H8193><s%> I have esteemed <S%H6845><s%> the words <S%H561><s%> of his mouth <S%H6310><s%> more than my necessary <S%H2706><s%> food.
But he is in one <S%H259><s%> mind, and who <S%H4310><s%> can turn <S%H7725><s%> him? and what his soul <S%H5315><s%> desires, <S%H183><s%> even that he does. <S%H6213><s%>
For he performes <S%H7999><s%> the thing that is appointed <S%H2706><s%> for me: and many <S%H7227><s%> such <S%H2007><s%> things are with him.
Therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> am I troubled <S%H926><s%> at his presence: <S%H6440><s%> when I consider, <S%H995><s%> I am afraid <S%H6342><s%> of him.
For God <S%H410><s%> makes my heart <S%H3820><s%> soft, <S%H7401><s%> and the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> troubles <S%H926><s%> me:
Because <S%H3588><s%> I was not cut <S%H6789><s%> off before <S%H6440><s%> the darkness, <S%H2822><s%> neither has he covered <S%H3680><s%> the darkness <S%H652><s%> from my face. <S%H6440><s%>
